setVariants.name: Reverse Holo
setVariants.description: The reverse holo print of the set.

setVariants.name: Unlimited
setVariants.description: The unlimited print of the set.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Aggron.

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Withering Dust
abilities.text: As long as Beautifly is in play, do not apply Resistance for all Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Parallel Gain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon, including Beautifly.

abilities.name: Firestarter
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Blaziken is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fire Stream
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Blaziken. If you do, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Lava Burn
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 basic Energy cards attached to Camerupt or this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Energy Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 1 Energy card from your hand. Then draw up to 3 cards from your deck. This power can't be used if Delcatty is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Max Energy Source
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Active Pokémon.

abilities.name: Protective Dust
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, except damage, done to Dustox by the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

abilities.name: Psy Shadow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Gardevoir is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the total amount of Energy attached to Gardevoir and the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Slap Push
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mega Throw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Attract Current
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Manectric does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as Mightyena is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Shakedown
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Lizard Poison
attacks.text: If 1 Energy is attached to Sceptile, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If 2 Energy is attached to Sceptile, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If 3 Energy is attached to Sceptile, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. If 4 or more Energy is attached to Sceptile, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Burned, and Poisoned.

abilities.name: Lazy
abilities.text: As long as Slaking is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Critical Move
attacks.text: Discard a basic Energy card attached to Slaking or this attack does nothing. Slaking can't attack during your next turn.

abilities.name: Water Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Swampert is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hypno Splash
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Wailord does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Blaziken.

attacks.name: Battle Blast
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fighting Energy attached to Breloom.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Invisible Hand
attacks.text: If any of your opponent's Active Pokémon are Evolved Pokémon, search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Repulsion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent returns the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. (If your opponent doesn't have any Benched Pokémon or other Active Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Stockpile
attacks.text: During your next turn, Spit Up's base damage is 70 instead of 30, and Swallow's base damage is 60 instead of 20.

attacks.name: Swallow
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from Pelipper the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon. If Pelipper has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), move a Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Sceptile is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fast Stream
attacks.text: Move 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to the other Defending Pokémon. (Ignore this effect if your opponent has only 1 Defending Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If Sharpedo is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Sharpedo is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Slash
attacks.text: You may discard a Darkness Energy card attached to Sharpedo. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Natural Remedy
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Swampert, remove 1 damage counter from Swampert.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Confusion Gas
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Poison Smog
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Hard Cocoon
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Cascoon would be damaged by an opponent's attack (after applying Weakness and Resistance), flip a coin. If heads, reduce that damage by 30.

attacks.name: Poison Thread
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.text: When you attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to Combusken, remove all Special Conditions from Combusken.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Energy Call
attacks.text: Attach 1 Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cannonball
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Delcatty but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to Electrike.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrike does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.text: When you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Grovyle, remove all Special Conditions from Grovyle.

attacks.name: Shove
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Slap Down
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Removal Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Life Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until it is 10 HP away from being Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: One-Two Strike
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Seek Out
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if there is only 1). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Marshtomp, remove all Special Conditions from Marshtomp.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Hard Cocoon
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Silcoon would be damaged by an opponent's attack (after applying Weakness and Resistance), flip a coin. If heads, reduce that damage by 30.

attacks.name: Gooey Thread
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Slack Off
attacks.text: Remove all damage counters from Slakoth. Slakoth can't attack during your next turn.

abilities.name: Drive Off
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Swellow is your Active Pokémon, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Your opponent picks the Benched Pokémon to switch. This power can't be used if Swellow is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Vigoroth.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 4 damage counters from Wailmer (all if there are less than 4). Wailmer is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Wailmer but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Teary Eyes
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Aron by attacks is reduced by 10.

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If Carvanha is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Carvanha is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Super Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Koffing does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage for each damage counter on Goldeen.

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Burn Off
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Trembler
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each Defending Pokémon, and each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If Ralts and the Defending Pokémon have a different amount of Energy attached to them, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 40.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Plus Energy
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Torchic.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for Silcoon and Beautifly, or Cascoon and Dustox cards. Show 1 card or both cards of a pair to your opponent and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Barb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Energy Removal 2
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

cards.name: Energy Restore
cards.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a Basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand. If you don't have that many basic Energy cards in your discard pile, put all of them into your hand.

cards.name: Energy Switch
cards.text: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Lady Outing
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck for up to 3 different types of basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Lum Berry
cards.text: Attach Lum Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.,At any time between turns, if the Pokémon this card is attached to is affected by any Special Conditions, remove all of them. Then discard Lum Berry.

cards.name: Oran Berry
cards.text: Attach Oran Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.,At any time between turns, if the Pokémon this card is attached to has at least 2 damage counters on it, remove 2 damage counters from it. Then discard Oran Berry.

cards.name: Poké Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Pokémon Reversal
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent switches 1 of his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: PokéNav
cards.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck, and choose a Basic Pokémon, Evolution card, or Energy card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Put the 2 other cards back on top of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Professor Birch
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Draw cards from your deck until you have 6 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Energy Search
cards.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Potion
cards.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (remove 1 damage counter if that Pokémon has only 1).

cards.name: Switch
cards.text: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Darkness Energy
cards.text: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect unless the Attacking Pokémon is Darkness or has Dark in its name. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Metal Energy
cards.text: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Rainbow Energy
cards.text: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Chansey ex
cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Healing Egg
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters (1 if there is only 1) from each of your Pokémon. Remove no damage counters from Chansey ex.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Chansey ex does 60 damage to itself.

cards.name: Electabuzz ex
cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Hitmonchan ex
cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Lapras ex
cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Ball
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Lapras ex but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Magmar ex
cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Mewtwo ex
cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile to Mewtwo ex.

cards.name: Scyther ex
cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Scyther ex during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Sneasel ex
cards.text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Beat Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each of your Pokémon in play (including Sneasel ex). This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
